answers.answer: MY controller at work--his daughter had that--and they decided(dr's) to deliver the baby within 24hrs of diagnosis.  It is very harmful to both mother and baby--after delivery every thing should go back to normal.  She was 4 1/2 weeks early--baby was healthy at 6lbs 4 oz.Hope everything goes well
If you have toxemia, your doctor may want to schedule an induction asap if you're far enough along because it's quite dangerous.
Just wanted to wish you lots of luck and hope all goes well with you and the baby.

Everyone should slow down just a bit before this poor woman is scared to death!! Bed rest is also advised before they induce. I know someone who got it at 13 weeks and was fine, just given bed rest. I know a total of 4 woman that had it and have a had heathy babies. It doesn't mean that they have to take the baby. You will be very closly monitored and if it gets bad enough (and you dont do your bed rest) you might have to be put in the hospital. So make sure you follow the doctors orders and everything should be okay.
I had this with son #1 and I was fine. I was on bedrest for 6 1/2 months and deleiverd 3 weeks early a 10 pound boy but healthy. Just take it easy and follow all the doc orders. :)

A few of my friends that have had preeclampsia, they were put on bed rest. 2 of them did all they could to rest but the MD's said there were problems with their kidneys and that is when they did inducements. If you are at the beginning of it, don't worry, just relax and do what the MD says. Good luck!

I agree they arnt necessairly going to induce right a way chances are they will monitor you and put you on bed rest. Yes this can be seriouse if you have an extreme case which I am not sure how common that it. I would just make sure to follow your doctors orders and keep in mind that they may induce you if they need to but I think ( I cant remember how far along you are) but you should be fine dont stress. Good Luck!

Yes, preclampsia is very serious but since you are 37 weeks you are fine. As long as they are monitoring you carefully the worst that can happen is for them to take the baby. That should be fine by 37 weeks. Many time it comes on bad around 24-30 weeks which causes a premature baby. My sister in law just had it and had to be induced at 30 weeks with her twins. They are fine but were really tiny when they were born. If they don't take the baby it can be extremely dangerous for the mommy. Delivery is the only cure for it.The pain you are having since being checked is normal too. I get crampy every time I am checked at the end. It irritates your cervix and makes you have more braxton hicks and contractions.

I had this with my last baby and delivered at 34 weeks. See my previous posts if interested in my experience. At 37 wks. relax! You are tech. "at term" The only cure is delivery, they just try to buy time if necessry for the babys health.

I went to the doctor today and I am 37 weeks and 4 days and my blood pressure was high, so my doctor is watching me for the same thing.  I am on bedrest now and am going to be induced on the 19th.  I go back to the doctor on Thursday and if my blood pressure hasn't gone down then they will send me in for the weekend to be induced.  I was scared to death when she started talking about the preclampsia...I was like what????  I mean everything has been perfect so far and then this when I am practically two weeks away from the due date.  Anyway, good luck with you and everything will be fine!
